tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage.store¶

ZarrStorage.store(new_data: Union[xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray, xarray.core.dataset.Dataset], compute: bool = True, remote: bool = False) → xarray.backends.zarr.ZarrStore¶

Store the data, the dtype and all the details will depend of what you pass in the new_data parameter, internally this method calls the to_zarr method with a ‘w’ mode using that data.

This method must be always called first to completly modify the tensor and the backup, once this method is used non of the other method will modify the tensor using the backup

Parameters
new_data: Union[xarray.DataArray, xarray.Dataset]

This is the data that want to be stored

remote: bool, default False

If the value is True indicate that we want to store the data directly in the backup in the other case it will store the data in your local path (then you can use the backup method manually)

Returns
An xarray.backends.ZarrStore produced by the
to_zarr method
tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage.read tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage.append
